Hello Bill.
Not sure of your intention with the comment. Sounds like disapp=
rovement, due to the negative conception of the "stereotype" word. Not even=
 sure of your idea of my idea by writing the list.

Let me state it again:
=
"I love doing so sometimes (Naming things) to know what am I referring to"
=
"I guess it helps understand where are we standing in terms of REST usabili=
ty and knowledge."

I had been in hundreds of discussions. Most of the time=
, two people discuss about different things that are named the same. So, my=
 first action is to clarify what I mean by that name. Just as I did now wit=
h my idea in the lines above.

Ok, let's start again: I've created a classi=
fication of the common understandings people that I've read and discussed w=
ith, had shown related to REST. The intention is to identify how is the RES=
T term used and understood. It makes no sense to put a face on each class, =
when we want common behavior for analysis. 

Sorry if taken as a bad thing.=
 Not my intention.

William.

--- In rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com, Bill de =

This other category may use the API idea, but they actually

h.

you have all those that think Standards are
